p: Total soluble protein and reducing sugar were high in fresh aerial parts of P. harmala shown in S3a and S3B Fig, respectively. Earlier [ 65] isolated antioxidant protein from P. harmala. Seeds possessed antioxidant activity, and this activity was due to the presence of hydrophobic amino acids. P. harmala is one of the most frequently used medicinal plants to treat hypertension and cardiac disease worldwide [ 66]. The maximum total soluble proteins (168.3±6.3 mg/g dry wt.) were depicted in dry aerial parts of T. simplex. No significant variation was observed in seed samples, the highest value of total soluble proteins (248.6±30 mg/g s. wt.) was found in F. bruguieri (F.b.N). Total oxidant status (TOS) was lower in F. indica (1275±475 μM/g. f. wt.) shown in S3D Fig.
